newsitem.title: CHINA: Special flight leaves Beijing for Xiamen to Manila.
newsitem.headline: Special flight leaves Beijing for Xiamen to Manila.

text.p: A special flight left Beijing's Xiyuan airport for the southeastern coastal city of Xiamen, carrying a passenger who would take a connecting flight to Manila, airport officials in Xiamen said on Tuesday.

The officials said they were unable to identify the passenger. However, North Korean defector Hwang Jang-yop was expected to take that route to the Philippines and South Korean reports said he had left Beijing early on Tuesday.
The special flight took off at about 7.00 a.m. (2300 GMT) from the Xiyuan military airport and was en route for Xiamen, the airport official said by telephone.
The passenger was expected to take the scheduled 10.10 a.m. (0210 GMT) Southern Airlines flight to Manila, the Xiamen airport official said.
Security remained tight around the South Korean consulate in Beijing where Hwang sought shelter on February 12, becoming the most senior official to defect from the Stalinist North.
